hackathon-rules:
Create a working app that meets the requirements and specifications described within one Challenge Vertical.
Apps will be explained and demonstrated by the team for the judging panel on May 23, 2015 at 6pm Hawaii Standard Time (HST).

*Review each of the sections below for a more detailed description and important requirements and restrictions.
YES!
If you're a minor, please identify yourself upon sign-up as we will require parental or legal guardian consent to participate.
Individuals and Companies cannot post a Submission that has been publicly available for more than one year as of the Competition start date.
May 22, 2015 by approximately 6:00 PM Hawaii Standard Time (“HST”) (the “Competition Submission Period”). Administrator’s computer is the official timekeeping device for this Competition.
Demos begin May 23, 2015 6PM HST for the judging panel.
Each Contestant will be required to provide the following as part of the Submission:
After the Competition Submission Period has ended, the Submission cannot be modified in any way until after Judging has ended.
The competition is organized around various “Verticals,” each associated with various prizes. At the time of drafting these rules, the three official Competition Verticals are yet to be determined:  EXAMPLES of potential verticals are 1) Data in Transportation, 2)Alternate modes of travel, 3)Parking, etc.

Contestants will own the intellectual property rights to their Submission.

Submissions will be posted after the event on the website. All Contestants will have the same ability to view Submissions posted on the website.

Submissions will be voted upon by a judging panel selected by the Organizers at their sole discretion. The judging panel will evaluate the Submissions on the criteria described within the pertinent Challenge Vertical AND “Challenge Brief,” available on the website. Then the finalists will be judged again by an expert judging panel, utilizing the criteria described within the pertinent Challenge Brief. The judging panel can be found on the website.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Best solution using/gathering data (e.g. crowdsource reporting, data visualization)
Best tools for making transportation more efficient (e.g. parking, maps, notifications)
Best solution for advancing alternate modes of travel (e.g. bike, rail, bus, rideshare)
